data.title: Sushi Traditionalists, Beware
data.text: This is a very popular place.  Within five minutes of the 5:00 pm opening, every seat was filled with enthusiastic diners.  The conveyor belt can be charming.  Nearly everything is uramaki or "sushi rolls" with rice wrapped around a piece of fish or vegetable.  Most of the offerings, like the California Roll are designed for American palates and usually unknown in Japan.  After an hour of waiting and watching, I never saw any nigiri, the type of sushi that consists of fish wrapped around a ball of rice.  Apparently nigiri style sushi is not as popular as rice rolls with this place's patrons.  I also noticed that unlike every sushi place I have ever patronized--including the ones at Whole Foods markets--the itamae, sushi chefs, were not wearing some kind of uniform, not even a white ccok's coat.  These gentlemen simply wore a black apron and cap over their street clothes.  Iconoclasts?  Maybe  To reiterate, Sushi Somo is popular with locals but it is not a place I can recommend.

data.title: love the sushi trolly thing...
data.text: Very upbeat, from the moment you enter you notice the movement of servers, the live hands of sushi chefs and the delicious sushi going around...it goes well with a tall Sapporo!

data.title: Delicious without breaking a bank
data.text: Loved the food! Sampled a lot, but favorites are: salmon, macrel, eal, albacore tuna. Sat by an elderly Asian couple who dine there 5/7 days a week:) which makes sense given the quality and taste of the food in the context of its affordability. The location is not great, but will definitely be back!

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Not suitable for quiet romantic dinner, as it's loud and crowded. Chefs are great, waitress was a lot of fun and sushi was delicious. Sign your name to the list near outdoor when the restaurant is full, and they will call your name when your table or place is ready. Take your friends and have fun!

data.title: Great food
data.text: My first visit of a sushi bar and I'm glad it was here. Julie was really nice and made me and my family feel at home. The Christmas Eve special had this place hopping! It is has a conveyer belt that carries sushi plates around in a circle are the chefs, it was really cool and the kids loved the experience!

data.title: Hilarious
data.text:
Entirely unassuming location, and on opening the door presented with a small and very noisy restaurant. Might have walked, but was entertaining clients. Some tables packed together, but the seats at the conveyor belt are the ones to go for. The main sushi chef is a nutter - very funny,loud and eccentric, but he and his team know how to knock out great food.

Of special interest was the uni - apparently from Santa Barbera, where he drives to collect it, rating it as the best in the world.

Had a great time and left completely stuffed with smiles all round.

data.title: Good Sushi & Service
data.text: I agree with a previous reviewer that this is a quirky & small place but in a good way. The service is great and the sushi and hot food are delicious and somewhat affordable depending on what you get. You can sit at one of the few tables or opt to sit at the sushi bar with the conveyor belt which Is what I would recommend. There are 2 "Itamae", sushi chefs, in the middle who turn out yummy sushi the whole time and you pick up whatever plates of sushi you want that come by on the belt. Each colored plate is a different price so you can add them up as you go. It's actually pretty entertaining as well. If your in the mood for sushi & in the area, I suggest going.

data.title: Love this place!!!!
data.text: Awesome people, awesome food. I love this place. The revolving sushi bar is awesome and watching the chefs prepare food in front of you is great. Everyone is super friendly and they are always joking with customers. Cool place.

data.title: Quirky, yummy sushi!
data.text: What a cool place with great sushi!  When we entered the restaurant, everyone in the place yelled "Hello!"  We found a spot at the revolving sushi bar and chose what we wanted as it passed by.  The prices are based on the color of the plates.  The sushi chef took good care of us and made us sushi rolls and a plate of sashimi based on what we chose from the bar.  It was all fresh and delicious.  Very festive and fun!

data.title: If I am rating the right place
data.text: If I am rating the right Sushi place I took my wife after hanging out in Redondo Beach thift shops, this place is great.  I spend a lot of money but it was work it.  Sitting at the bar and eating sushi from a roto belt with endless dishes.  Great place good music and nice people.  Good place to entertain.

data.title: I always love when a sushi restaurant has the plates go around on a track. You can grab what you want, or you can...
data.text: I always love when a sushi restaurant has the plates go around on a track. You can grab what you want, or you can always ask for something you don't see. My best recommendation for this place is the "Spicy Spicy Joy Joy" roll.
